quote_text: The happiness of your life depends upon the quality of your thoughts.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: You have power over your mind - not outside events. Realize this, and you will find strength.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: The best revenge is not to be like your enemy.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: Waste no more time arguing about what a good man should be. Be one.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: It is not death that a man should fear, but he should fear never beginning to live.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: Very little is needed to make a happy life; it is all within yourself, in your way of thinking.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: If it is not right, do not do it; if it is not true, do not say it.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: When you arise in the morning, think of what a precious privilege it is to be alive - to breathe, to think, to enjoy, to love.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: Accept the things to which fate binds you, and love the people with whom fate brings you together, but do so with all your heart.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: How ridiculous and how strange to be surprised at anything which happens in life!
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: Never let the future disturb you. You will meet it, if you have to, with the same weapons of reason which today arm you against the present.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: If anyone can refute me—show me I'm making a mistake or looking at things from the wrong perspective—I'll gladly change. It's the truth I'm after, and the truth never harmed anyone.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: Do not act as if you were going to live ten thousand years. Death hangs over you. While you live, while it is in your power, be good.
author: Marcus Aurelius

quote_text: Make the best use of what is in your power, and take the rest as it happens.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Don't explain your philosophy. Embody it.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: First say to yourself what you would be; and then do what you have to do.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matters.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: If you want to improve, be content to be thought foolish and stupid.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: No man is free who is not master of himself.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Only the educated are free.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: He who laughs at himself never runs out of things to laugh at.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Wealth consists not in having great possessions, but in having few wants.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Don't seek to have events happen as you wish, but wish them to happen as they do happen, and all will be well with you.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Man is disturbed not by things, but by the views he takes of them.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: It is impossible for a man to learn what he thinks he already knows.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: We have two ears and one mouth so that we can listen twice as much as we speak.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Difficulties are things that show a person what they are.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: We suffer not from the events in our lives, but from our judgment about them.
author: Epictetus

quote_text: Luck is what happens when preparation meets opportunity.
author: Seneca

quote_text: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by rulers as useful.
author: Seneca

quote_text: Difficulties strengthen the mind, as labor does the body.
author: Seneca

quote_text: As is a tale, so is life: not how long it is, but how good it is, is what matters.
author: Seneca

quote_text: If a man knows not to which port he sails, no wind is favorable.
author: Seneca

quote_text: The greatest obstacle to living is expectancy, which hangs upon tomorrow and loses today.
author: Seneca

quote_text: Begin at once to live, and count each separate day as a separate life.
author: Seneca

quote_text: Life is long if you know how to use it.
author: Seneca

quote_text: Wherever there is a human being, there is an opportunity for a kindness.
author: Seneca

quote_text: Sometimes even to live is an act of courage.
author: Seneca

quote_text: It is not the man who has too little, but the man who craves more, that is poor.
author: Seneca
